troubleshooting.title: Crash at Startup on Windows with an Error About the nvoglv32.dll File

keywords.indexterm: Error: Startup crash - Fault Module Name nvoglv32.dll

condition.title: Problem
condition.p: I try to start on Windows but it crashed with an error message about Fault Module Name: nvoglv32.dll. What is the problem?

cause.title: Cause
cause.p: It is most likely an OpenGL driver issue.

steps-informal.p: This can be avoided by creating an empty file called opengl32.dll in the install folder (if you start with the shortcut created by the installer on the Start menu or on Desktop) or in the subfolder bin of the home folder of the Java virtual machine that runs (if you start with the oxygen.bat script). The home folder of the Java virtual machine that runs is the value of the java.home property that is available in the System properties tab of the About dialog box ( Help About ).
